Note that these welfare changes are somewhat different from the evaluations of the similar question in the empirical literature. Empirical studies compare the earnings of comparable individuals across locations for given factor prices. In our experiment, we compute the earnings before and after all the migrants in the world are returned to their home countries, allowing for general-equilibrium effects on all prices. 40 To be precise, we take the simple average of the percentage welfare change across all the individuals in the world, migrants and the non-migrants.
